intro: Rhizocephalum candollei var. laciniatum, commonly known as the lacey rhizocephalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage.
